alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:27AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marshall County through 500 AM CDT... At 427 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Blue Rapids, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Frankfort. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
